question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Donald Trump Jr. has not publicly announced a candidacy for the 2024 US Presidential Election. While he is a prominent figure within the Republican Party due to his father's influence and his own activities, there is limited evidence to suggest he is actively seeking the nomination. The Republican field for the 2024 election includes several strong and established candidates, including former President Donald Trump, who maintains substantial support within the party. Additionally, establishing a successful presidential campaign typically requires significant political infrastructure, fundraising capabilities, and widespread party support, which Donald Trump Jr. has not demonstrated to the same extent as other contenders. Considering these factors, it is unlikely that Donald Trump Jr. will be selected as the Republican nominee.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Asa Hutchinson, the Governor of Arkansas, has not emerged as a prominent candidate in the race for the Republican nomination for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. The Republican primary field includes several high-profile candidates such as former President Donald Trump, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, and others who have secured significant support and media attention. Hutchinson's political profile, while strong within Arkansas, does not currently match the national visibility and support required to secure the nomination, especially given the crowded and competitive primary landscape. Additionally, there have been no significant developments or announcements indicating a serious presidential campaign launch by Hutchinson.

question.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates or combinations will resolve as **No**. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: In the United States presidential election system, each major political party nominates one presidential candidate and typically one vice-presidential candidate. The Republican National Convention selects a single nominee for president based on the delegates' votes. Having two individuals, Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson, both nominated as presidential candidates by the same party would be unprecedented and highly unlikely. Additionally, there is no mechanism within the party's nomination process to support dual presidential candidates. Given these factors, the probability that both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election is exceedingly low.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, President Joe Biden has not indicated any intention to step down or decline to seek re-election in 2024. Historically, incumbent presidents typically announce their re-election campaigns well before the election year, often solidifying their plans within the first half of the election cycle. Biden has maintained an active role in his administration without signs of withdrawing from the race. Additionally, there have been no credible reports or indications from his campaign that suggest a change in his candidacy status. Given these factors, it is unlikely that Biden will make a definitive and public announcement declaring that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there have been discussions and some legal opinions regarding the applicability of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment to disqualify individuals like Donald Trump from holding federal office. However, there have been no official actions, court decisions, or credible media reports confirming his removal or blocking from any primary election ballot. The process to remove a candidate under this amendment would require significant legal and political actions, including court rulings and state-level implementations, which are complex and unprecedented in this context. Given the lack of concrete developments and the high legal hurdles involved, it is unlikely that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Donald Trump has maintained a significant presence within the Republican Party since his presidency, continuing to influence its direction and rallying a substantial base of supporters. His decision to run again for the 2024 Presidential Election has been a central topic in Republican circles, and he has actively engaged in campaigning and endorsing other candidates, which helps consolidate his influence. However, there are emerging contenders within the party, such as Ron DeSantis and Nikki Haley, who are also gaining traction and support. The Republican National Convention will ultimately determine the nominee based on delegate support, which can be influenced by primary election outcomes, debates, and shifting party dynamics. Additionally, external factors such as the political climate, economic conditions, and unforeseen events leading up to the convention could impact the outcome. Considering Trump's established base and influence, coupled with the uncertainties of the political landscape, it is likely that he has a strong chance of securing the nomination, though it is not guaranteed.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this part resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will resolve as "No". The question will resolve as "No" if either of these conditions is not met.

metadata.chain_of_thought: For both conditions to be met, two significant and potentially conflicting events would need to occur by July 15, 2024. (a) Removing or blocking Donald Trump from the primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment would require substantial legal action, including court rulings and state-level decisions. As of the latest information, there are no active legal proceedings or strong indications that such efforts are underway with a high likelihood of success within the given timeframe. (b) Simultaneously, Donald Trump remains a prominent and influential figure within the Republican Party, with a substantial base of support that positions him as a leading contender for the Republican nomination in the 2024 Presidential Election. The likelihood of successfully removing Trump from all primary ballots while he concurrently securing the Republican nomination is extremely low, as these two outcomes are largely contradictory. Achieving both would require unprecedented legal and political developments within a short period.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: The question revolves around the likelihood of an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before a specified deadline. Given that he is the sitting president and assuming he is in generally good health, the probability of such an announcement occurring within a short timeframe is quite low. Historical data on the health of public figures, especially those in high office, suggests that sudden announcements of death are rare unless there are known health issues. Additionally, there is no indication of any imminent health crisis that would lead to such an announcement. Therefore, I estimate the probability of this question resolving YES as being very low, reflecting the unlikelihood of an unexpected death announcement. Probability: 0.05

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of the latest available information up to October 2023, President Joe Biden is serving his term, which is scheduled to conclude in January 2025. Historically, U.S. presidents typically serve their full terms unless unforeseen circumstances arise, such as severe health issues or significant political upheaval. There have been no credible indications or events suggesting that President Biden intends to resign or that there are imminent risks to his presidency. Additionally, the peaceful transfer of power is a well-established norm in U.S. politics. Considering these factors, it is highly likely that President Biden will remain in office through the end of July 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO otherwise. Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not impact the resolution as long as he remains President.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of the latest available information up to October 2023, President Joe Biden is actively serving as the President of the United States without any publicly disclosed severe health issues that would suggest an imminent risk. While it's true that mortality is an inherent possibility for all individuals, especially those of advanced age, there have been no indications or credible reports suggesting that President Biden is facing any immediate life-threatening conditions. Additionally, the formal processes in place for presidential succession ensure that even in the unlikely event of the President's passing, the Vice President would assume the duties of the office. Given these factors, the likelihood of both an official announcement of President Biden's death before the specified date and his remaining in office through the end of July 2024 is exceedingly low.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Indian National Congress (INC) has historically been one of India's major political parties. However, in recent elections leading up to 2024, the INC has struggled to regain the significant influence it once held, largely overshadowed by the dominant Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). The BJP, under the leadership of Narendra Modi, has maintained a strong and cohesive voter base, capitalizing on economic growth narratives and nationalistic sentiments. For the INC to form the government in the 2024 general elections, it would likely need to form successful alliances with regional parties to broaden its appeal and counter the BJP's consolidated support. Additionally, factors such as anti-incumbency sentiments, policy successes or failures of the current government, leadership effectiveness within the INC, and prevailing economic conditions will play pivotal roles. Given the current political climate, the challenges INC faces in revitalizing its base, and the BJP's entrenched position, the probability of INC forming the government in the next general election appears low.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The provided context indicates that dozens of House Democrats are actively organizing to oppose the Democratic National Committee's plan to secure President Joe Biden's nomination early. Rep. Jared Huffman has been involved in drafting a letter aimed at voicing this opposition, emphasizing concerns that the early nomination stifles necessary debate. While Huffman has not confirmed the existence of the letter, the fact that 'dozens' of Democrats are mobilizing suggests a strong likelihood that at least 20 House or Senate members will sign such a public letter. Additionally, the willingness to collaborate on multiple letters to meet the 20-signature threshold further supports the probability of this outcome.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

While internal disagreements and differing opinions are natural within any political party, it is uncommon for a significant number of senators from the same party to publicly call for the withdrawal of their party's primary candidate without substantial cause. Achieving a threshold of 10 or more Democratic Senators dissenting against Biden would imply considerable turmoil or unforeseen events within the party, neither of which are evident at this time. Therefore, the likelihood of such a scenario unfolding before July 20 is low.

question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. This includes multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures.

2. 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, as confirmed by the New York Times source.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves to YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, I do not have access to specific events or developments that may occur between then and July 2024. However, I can provide an analysis based on general political dynamics and historical precedents. Securing signatures from at least 20 House or Senate Democrats opposing an early virtual nomination of Biden would require significant intra-party consensus, which is often challenging given the diversity of opinions within the Democratic Party. Additionally, having 10 or more Democratic Senators publicly call for Biden to drop out before July 20th would indicate a substantial level of dissent, which is uncommon unless there are extraordinary circumstances affecting Biden's candidacy. Considering these factors, while not impossible, the likelihood of both conditions being met simultaneously appears low based on typical party cohesion and the high threshold required for such coordinated actions.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

This trend indicates that while the USA remains a top contender, the margin between Gold and Silver medals is narrow, often leaning slightly towards Silver. Unless there are significant improvements in the performance of American athletes or substantial changes in the competitive landscape leading up to the Paris 2024 Olympics, it is likely that the USA will continue to secure a similar balance between Gold and Silver medals. Therefore, the probability that the USA will win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics is relatively low.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

metadata.chain_of_thought:
The United States has consistently been a dominant force in the Olympic Games, frequently leading the medal table due to its strong performances across a wide range of sports, including athletics, swimming, and gymnastics. Heading into the Paris 2024 Olympics, the USA is expected to maintain its robust training programs and athlete preparation, which bodes well for their medal prospects.

However, the competitive landscape has been evolving. China has been steadily increasing its investment in Olympic sports and improving its medal tally, challenging the traditional dominance of countries like the USA. Additionally, the host nation, France, may have a home advantage that could lead to higher performance in specific sports. Factors such as potential geopolitical issues, athlete readiness, and emerging talents from other nations could also influence the final standings.

Considering these variables, while the USA is likely to perform strongly and has a good chance of topping the medal table, the competition is intensifying, and there are uncertainties that could affect the outcome.

question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table that orders by number of Gold Medals, then Silver, then Bronze. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves negatively if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

However, securing a first-ever gold medal is even more challenging, as it requires not only participating but also outperforming established competitors in a given sport. In recent Olympics, the number of countries winning their first gold has been fewer than those winning their first medal. Achieving both milestones—having at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal and at least 5 countries win their first Olympic gold—would require an exceptional level of success and diversity in the 2024 Paris Games. Considering past trends and the competitive nature of the Olympics, it is unlikely that both conditions will be met to the extent specified.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Donald Trump remains a dominant figure within the Republican Party and is widely regarded as the frontrunner for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination. Glenn Youngkin, while a prominent Republican and Governor of Virginia, has not demonstrated the same level of national support or recognition necessary to secure the nomination against a candidate like Trump, who has a substantial and dedicated base. Additionally, the dynamics of the Republican National Convention often favor established leaders with proven track records in previous elections. Unless there are significant shifts in the political landscape or unforeseen developments, it is unlikely that Youngkin would surpass Trump's support to become the nominee.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The current reports indicate that within the Democratic Party, there is some internal pressure on President Biden regarding his re-election campaign. Specifically, two safe-seat members and two endangered Democrats have publicly expressed doubts about Biden's chances, and there are drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats advocating for Biden to end his campaign. However, for the market to resolve to YES, at least five named Democratic US House Members or US Senators must collectively urge Biden to drop out before July 20th. While there is evidence of behind-the-scenes discussions and dissatisfaction, the transition from individual opinions to a unified, named group action requires significant coordination and consensus, which can be challenging to achieve, especially within a party's leadership structure. Additionally, no public confirmation of five named members acting together has been reported yet. Given these factors, while there is some movement in that direction, the likelihood of meeting the specific criteria by the specified deadline remains relatively low.

question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in many regions, including various countries within the European Union. While the EU has been actively discussing and implementing regulations related to artificial intelligence to ensure safety, transparency, and fairness, there have been no definitive actions or announcements indicating that ChatGPT would be restricted or banned in the near future. OpenAI has been proactive in complying with regional regulations and adapting its services accordingly. Additionally, given the widespread adoption and integration of ChatGPT in both consumer and business applications across the EU, it is reasonable to expect that the service will remain available by June 30, 2024, barring any unforeseen regulatory changes or significant geopolitical events that could impact its availability.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Chasiv Yar is a strategically important location in the Donetsk Oblast of Ukraine. Control over this area has been contested between Russian and Ukrainian forces since the escalation of the conflict in 2022. Several factors influence the likelihood of Russia maintaining control over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024:

1. **Ukrainian Counteroffensives**: Ukraine has demonstrated significant resilience and capability in mounting counteroffensives, especially with continued Western support in terms of military aid and intelligence.

2. **Russian Military Logistics and Morale**: Russian forces have faced logistical challenges and morale issues, which could impact their ability to sustain long-term control over contested regions.

3. **International Sanctions and Diplomatic Pressure**: Ongoing international sanctions against Russia may hinder their ability to procure necessary resources for maintaining control over occupied territories.

4. **Local Resistance and Partisan Activities**: Increased local resistance and partisan warfare within occupied areas like Chasiv Yar can undermine Russian control and stability.

5. **Strategic Importance**: While Chasiv Yar holds strategic value, it may not be as high a priority compared to other regions, potentially leading to decreased focus and resources allocated by Russian forces.

Considering these factors, while Russia has established control over parts of Donetsk Oblast, the dynamic nature of the conflict and the strengths of Ukrainian resistance make it moderately unlikely that Russia will maintain control over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, incumbent Democratic President Joe Biden has signaled his intention to seek re-election in 2024. Historically, incumbent presidents who run for re-election often secure their party's nomination, reducing the likelihood of a contested primary that could open the field for other candidates, including female contenders. While there are notable women in the Democratic Party, such as Vice President Kamala Harris and Senator Elizabeth Warren, Biden's strong position within the party makes it probable that he will be the nominee. Additionally, the Democratic Party has only nominated a woman once in recent history (Hillary Clinton in 2016), which suggests a precedent but not necessarily a current trend favoring a female nominee for 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if both of the following occur: (1) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (2) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. If either or both of these conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that both Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, and that the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a woman, we need to assess each condition separately and then consider their combined likelihood.

1. **Joe Biden's Mortality Before July 26th, 2024:**
   - **Age and Health:** As of October 2023, Joe Biden is 81 years old. The mortality risk increases with age, and while specific health details post-October 2023 are unknown, general actuarial data suggests that an 81-year-old male has a noticeable risk within a year.
   - **Historical Data:** Statistically, the one-year mortality rate for men in their early 80s is approximately 10-12%.
   - **Assumption:** Assigning a conservative estimate, we'll use a 10% probability that Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024.

2. **Democratic Nominee Being a Woman:**
   - **Current Political Landscape:** As of October 2023, Joe Biden has indicated intentions to seek re-election, and there hasn't been a prominent movement within the Democratic Party to nominate a woman in place of him.
   - **Nomination Dynamics:** If Biden remains alive and continues his campaign, the nominee will likely be himself. If he were to pass away, the Democratic Party would then need to select a replacement. Historically, the party has not always selected female candidates unless there are strong contenders or circumstances necessitate it.
   - **Probability Assessment:** Considering the current trajectory and historical patterns, there's a relatively low probability (around 15%) that the Democratic nominee would be a woman, either through Biden stepping aside voluntarily or the party choosing a woman after a hypothetical event like his passing.

3. **Combined Probability:**
   - Assuming independence between the two events (which might not entirely hold, but for estimation purposes we'll treat them as such), the combined probability is the product of the individual probabilities.
   - **Calculation:** 10% (0.10) * 15% (0.15) = 1.5%

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

metadata.chain_of_thought: The projected opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" is estimated between $340 million and $360 million globally, surpassing the current R-rated movie record of $284.5 million held by the original "Deadpool." The combination of strong brand recognition from both the Deadpool and Wolverine franchises, the star power of Ryan Reynolds, expanded theater releases, and effective marketing campaigns all support the likelihood of achieving these projections. Additionally, historical performance of similar blockbuster R-rated films like "It" and "Joker" indicates a robust market appetite for such movies. While projections are optimistic and actual results could be influenced by factors like competition during the release weekend or unforeseen market conditions, the substantial margin above the existing record and positive industry sentiment make it probable that "Deadpool x Wolverine" will set a new opening weekend record for R-rated movies.

However, publishing such detailed reports involves considerations around proprietary information, competitive advantage, and the extent to which external parties are trusted and capable of conducting thorough assessments. Given these factors and the relatively tight timeframe until June 30, 2024, it is plausible but not certain that both companies will release such reports within this period.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there is no public indication or evidence to suggest that President Joe Biden intends to drop out of the race before July 20, 2024. President Biden has been actively campaigning and outlining his policies for the upcoming election. Additionally, there have been no significant health concerns, political pressures, or other factors reported that would likely compel him to withdraw from the race at this stage. Historical patterns also show that incumbent presidents typically remain in the race unless faced with extraordinary circumstances.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Will Hurd has not publicly announced any intention to seek the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Hurd, a former U.S. Representative from Texas, has previously indicated a preference for focusing on private sector opportunities and has not shown strong interest in pursuing higher political office again. The Republican field for 2024 includes several prominent figures such as Donald Trump, Ron DeSantis, and others who have established significant support within the party and broader recognition among voters. Additionally, Will Hurd's political influence and fundraising capabilities are not on par with the leading candidates, making it less likely for him to secure the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 (b) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met. 
(b) Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, President Joe Biden shows no signs of intending to drop out of the 2024 election race before July 20. Incumbent presidents typically remain in the race unless unforeseen circumstances arise. Additionally, Will Hurd, while a notable Republican figure, has not demonstrated significant momentum or support to secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The Republican field is expected to be competitive, and no indications suggest that Hurd will emerge as the nominee. Therefore, the probability of both events occurring simultaneously is extremely low.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, the European Union (EU) and China maintain a multifaceted trade relationship characterized by both cooperation and competition. China's prominence in the electric vehicle (EV) market, with manufacturers like BYD gaining significant global market share, has prompted the EU to bolster its own EV industry to ensure competitiveness and reduce reliance on foreign imports. While the EU has implemented tariffs on certain Chinese goods in the past, the decision to impose new tariffs specifically on Chinese electric vehicles would likely depend on several factors, including trade imbalances, concerns over market practices such as subsidies or dumping, and broader geopolitical tensions. Additionally, the EU's commitment to environmental sustainability and supporting domestic industries might influence its stance on EV imports. However, as of October 2023, there have been no definitive announcements or strong indications from credible sources suggesting that the EU is planning to introduce new tariffs on Chinese EVs in the near future. Therefore, while it's within the realm of possibility, the likelihood of such tariffs being announced by July 5, 2024, appears to be relatively low.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the information provided, there are already two safe-seat Democratic House members publicly urging President Biden to step aside, and two more endangered Democrats have privately expressed doubts about his re-election prospects. Additionally, multiple drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, and at least one draft calls for Biden to end his campaign, according to five sources. However, the market specifically requires that at least five named Democratic House Members or U.S. Senators collectively pressure Biden to drop out publicly before July 20th. As of the current information, only two have publicly made such calls, and the others remain either unnamed or have not formalized a collective public stance. Given the high threshold of needing five named individuals to act collectively and the current public actions falling short of this requirement, it seems unlikely that the criteria for a YES resolution will be met by the specified date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
For the resolution to be YES, both events (a) and (b) must occur within the specified timeframes.

(a) **EU Tariffs on Chinese Electric Vehicles by July 5, 2024:**  The European Union has been actively working to develop its own electric vehicle (EV) industry and has shown interest in reducing dependency on non-EU manufacturers, including those from China. While there are ongoing discussions and measures aimed at promoting sustainability and competitiveness within the EU automotive sector, the imposition of new tariffs specifically targeting Chinese EV imports would represent a significant policy shift. Such a move would likely require consensus among EU member states and could provoke trade tensions with China, potentially leading to retaliatory measures. Given the complexity of international trade agreements and the time required to negotiate and implement new tariffs, the likelihood of the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs by early July 2024 is moderate but not highly probable.

(b) **Pressure from At Least 5 Named Democratic House Members or US Senators on Biden to Drop Out by July 20, 2024:**  Within the Democratic Party, President Joe Biden has maintained a relatively strong position, with substantial support from key party members. For at least five named Democratic House Members or US Senators to publicly pressure Biden to drop out of the 2024 re-election race would indicate significant intra-party dissent. Such an occurrence would likely stem from major policy disagreements, personal controversies, or shifts in political strategy. Given Biden's current standing and the typical dynamics of party support for incumbent presidents, it is relatively unlikely that this level of organized pressure would materialize within the specified timeframe.

Considering the independent probabilities of each event and recognizing that both need to occur for a YES resolution, the combined likelihood is relatively low.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, the New York Knicks have shown signs of improvement and possess a talented roster with key players who can contribute significantly to their success. However, winning the NBA Finals is an exceptionally challenging achievement that requires not only a strong team but also consistent performance throughout the season, effective coaching, and sometimes a bit of luck with injuries and other unforeseen factors. The NBA landscape is highly competitive, with several other teams like the Milwaukee Bucks, Boston Celtics, Miami Heat, and Philadelphia 76ers also vying for the championship. Unless the Knicks make significant strides in player development, maintain excellent team health, and capitalize on favorable matchups, the probability of them winning the 2024 NBA Finals remains relatively low.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Miami Heat have consistently been competitive in the NBA, known for their strong coaching, player development, and a resilient team culture. Leading up to October 2023, the Heat have maintained a solid roster with key players performing well, and they've demonstrated the ability to adapt and overcome challenges during the season. However, the NBA is highly competitive with several other strong teams vying for the championship, including those with superstar talents and deep bench strength. Additionally, factors such as potential injuries, mid-season trades, and the inherent unpredictability of sports outcomes add layers of uncertainty. While the Heat have a respectable chance of winning the 2024 NBA Finals, the competition's intensity and these variables suggest that their probability of securing the championship is significant but not overwhelming.

question.title: Will both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** only if both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat are crowned champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). Since only one team can be crowned champion, this question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The NBA Finals determine a single champion each year, meaning only one team can win the championship. Both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat cannot simultaneously secure the title in the same year. Therefore, it is impossible for both teams to win the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

metadata.chain_of_thought: President Joe Biden has not indicated any intention to resign or step down from office before the end of his term. Despite being the oldest president in U.S. history, there have been no significant health concerns or public signs suggesting he may not complete his presidency. Additionally, the current political environment does not present substantial threats that could lead to his removal or resignation. Considering these factors and the lack of foreseeable events that might prevent him from serving through the end of July 2024, it is highly likely that Biden will remain President until that time.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, there have been no official actions by any U.S. state to remove or block Donald Trump from primary election ballots under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. Implementing such a removal requires substantial legal processes, including court decisions or official state government actions based on concrete evidence of insurrection or rebellion, which has not been conclusively established. Additionally, political considerations and Trump’s significant support base make it unlikely that states would pursue this action without overwhelming legal impetus. Given the timeframe until July 15, 2024, and the absence of current movements towards such a disqualification, the probability of Trump being removed or blocked from any primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified amendment is low.

Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Resolves NO if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. To determine the probability that both (a) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment occur, we assess each condition individually:

(a) **Biden remains President through end of July 2024**: Assuming no unforeseen circumstances such as resignation, death, or impeachment leading to removal, it is highly likely that Joe Biden will continue to serve as President until the specified date. Historically, incumbents have stability in their terms barring exceptional events.

(b) **Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment**: Section 3 of the 14th Amendment is a rarely invoked provision, typically requiring substantial legal and political actions to enforce. Given the high legal and procedural hurdles, the likelihood of this occurring by July 2024 is relatively low.

Assuming independence between the two events, the combined probability is the product of their individual probabilities. Given that (a) is highly likely (estimated at 90%) and (b) is unlikely (estimated at 5%), the joint probability is:

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on historical polling trends and recent data up to October 2023, Donald Trump has shown periods of leading over Joe Biden in national polling averages. Given the competitive nature of the 2024 presidential race and assuming that no significant political events drastically shift voter sentiment between now and July 15, 2024, it's plausible that Trump's lead could remain within the specified range of greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average. However, considering factors such as campaign developments, economic conditions, and potential shifts in voter preferences, there is some uncertainty in this projection.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, President Joe Biden has not made any public statements indicating that he intends to forgo seeking a second term. Historically, incumbent presidents typically announce their re-election campaigns within the first half of their first term, often around the midpoint or earlier. Biden was inaugurated in January 2021, so an announcement to decline the Democratic nomination by July 2024 would be unusually premature, especially without any public indicators of intent not to run. Additionally, there have been no credible reports or signals from Biden or his campaign suggesting a decision not to seek re-election. Given these factors, it seems unlikely that Biden will make such an announcement before the specified date.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of the knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden has not indicated any definitive plans to decline the Democratic nomination for the 2024 presidential election. Historically, incumbent presidents seeking re-election are likely to accept their party's nomination unless significant unforeseen circumstances arise. Additionally, Donald Trump's polling lead over Biden within the specified range (greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points) by July 15, 2024, is uncertain and subject to various political dynamics, campaign developments, and voter sentiments leading up to that date. The combination of Biden potentially staying in the race and the tight polling margin makes the simultaneous occurrence of both events relatively unlikely.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Greece has a strong history in the Eurovision Song Contest, consistently qualifying for the Grand Final over the past decade. The country benefits from a dedicated fan base and often selects high-quality entries that resonate well with both juries and the public. Additionally, Greece's strategic positioning in semi-finals and favorable voting patterns enhance their chances of qualification. While each year's competition presents unique challenges, the combination of Greece's experience, selection process, and fan support suggests a high likelihood of qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Lithuania's performance in the Eurovision Song Contest has been inconsistent over the years, with periods of both successful qualifications and non-qualifications for the Grand Final. Their ability to qualify for Eurovision 2024 will depend on several factors, including the strength and appeal of their selected entry, the staging and presentation, as well as the competition within their semi-final group. Additionally, geopolitical factors and voting patterns can influence the outcomes. Considering Lithuania's historical performance and the competitive nature of Eurovision, there is a moderate likelihood of them qualifying for the Grand Final, but significant uncertainty remains without specific details about their 2024 entry.

question.title: Will both Greece and Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability that both Greece and Lithuania qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, we can examine their historical performances and current trends up to October 2023. Greece has consistently been a strong contender in Eurovision, often securing a spot in the Grand Final and achieving high rankings in several years. Their entries typically feature memorable performances and songs that resonate well with both juries and the public. Lithuania, while participating regularly, has had a more variable track record, with some years resulting in qualification and others not making it to the final. Factors such as song quality, performance execution, and voting patterns play significant roles in their chances. Assuming both countries select competitive entries and maintain their historical performance levels, there is a reasonable likelihood for Greece to qualify. Lithuania's qualification is slightly less certain given their inconsistent past results. Combining these assessments, the probability that both Greece and Lithuania will qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final is moderate.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden, the incumbent president, generally holds an advantage in polling against potential challengers like Donald Trump. FiveThirtyEight's election forecasts typically factor in incumbency, approval ratings, fundraising, and historical voting patterns. Assuming no major shifts in the political landscape, campaign dynamics, or unexpected events between now and July 19, 2024, it is likely that FiveThirtyEight will project Biden as the favorite. However, Donald Trump's significant base and potential for strong campaigning could still make the race competitive, preventing an overwhelming certainty in Biden’s favor.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Kamala Harris has not officially announced her vice-presidential pick for the 2024 election. The two leading candidates for her running mate are Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Both individuals have strong political backgrounds and have garnered significant support within their respective parties. Mark Kelly, a U.S. Senator from Arizona and a former astronaut, has a notable public profile and bipartisan appeal. Josh Shapiro, the Governor of Pennsylvania, has demonstrated effective leadership and governance, which could be appealing for a national ticket. Given that these two are the primary favorites and there hasn't been substantial indication of another prominent candidate emerging, it is likely that Kamala Harris will choose between them. Therefore, considering the current political landscape and the support each candidate has, the probability that Kamala Harris’ VP pick will be either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro is relatively high.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight project Joe Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris announce her VP pick as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will project Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. Changes in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not affect the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.

(b) Kamala Harris will announce her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will be based on Kamala Harris's own confirmation of her VP pick. If she announces anyone else, this will resolve as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that both events (a) and (b) occur, we'll analyze each separately and then consider their combined likelihood.

**(a) FiveThirtyEight projecting Joe Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024:** As of the knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Joe Biden is the incumbent president. Historically, incumbents often have an advantage in elections unless there are significant shifts in public opinion or unforeseen events that negatively impact their standing. FiveThirtyEight employs data-driven models that consider various factors, including approval ratings, economic indicators, and historical trends. Given Biden's incumbency and assuming no major negative developments, it's plausible that FiveThirtyEight would project him as the favorite around mid-July 2024. However, election dynamics can change rapidly, so while likely, there's inherent uncertainty.

**(b) Kamala Harris announcing her VP pick as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th:** Kamala Harris is currently serving as Vice President under Joe Biden. For her to announce a new VP pick suggests a shift that typically aligns with a presidential campaign or a significant strategic change within the administration. As of October 2023, there hasn't been public indication that VP Harris intends to leave her position or announce a new running mate within such a short timeframe. Additionally, both Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro are prominent political figures, but there's no clear public trajectory indicating they are being positioned as VP candidates by Harris. Given the short window between July 16 and August 7, 2024, and the lack of signals pointing towards this move, the likelihood of this announcement is relatively low.

**Combined Assessment:** While FiveThirtyEight projecting Biden as the favorite is plausible, the simultaneous announcement of a new VP pick by Kamala Harris within the specified short timeframe appears unlikely based on available information and typical political patterns.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: Liz Cheney has been a prominent figure within the Republican Party, known for her vocal opposition to former President Donald Trump, especially regarding his role in the events surrounding the January 6th Capitol riot. This stance has both garnered her respect among certain factions of the party and alienated her from others who remain staunch Trump supporters. As the Republican National Convention approaches, the party's nomination process is heavily influenced by its current base, which, as of recent trends, still shows significant support for Trump or candidates aligned with his views. If either Poland or Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that both Poland and Latvia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, we can analyze their historical performance and trends up to October 2023.

**Poland:**
Poland has had a mixed track record in Eurovision since the introduction of semi-finals in 2004. In recent years, Poland has qualified for the Grand Final approximately 40% of the time. Factors influencing their qualification include the selection process for their entries, the competitiveness of the song, staging, and voting patterns within the contest.

**Latvia:**
Latvia has generally performed better in Eurovision compared to Poland. Over the past decade, Latvia has qualified for the Grand Final about 70% of the time. Their entries often resonate well with both jury and public votes, and they have a history of strong performances that appeal to a broad European audience.

Assuming that the performances of Poland and Latvia in Eurovision 2024 are independent of each other, the combined probability of both countries qualifying can be calculated by multiplying their individual probabilities:

Probability(Poland qualifies) = 0.4
Probability(Latvia qualifies) = 0.7
Combined Probability = 0.4 * 0.7 = 0.28

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?

metadata.chain_of_thought: The current Olympic record for the men's 100m dash is 9.63 seconds, set by Usain Bolt in 2012. Recent Olympic winning times have consistently been above 9.70 seconds, and there have been no indications of athletes approaching the 9.63-second mark. Given the historical performance trends and the extraordinary nature of breaking such a longstanding record, it is highly unlikely that the winning time at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics will be under 9.63 seconds.
