metadata.chain_of_thought: The Identity and Democracy (ID) group in the European Parliament consists of right-wing to far-right parties and has been growing in influence over recent years. However, historically, the largest groups in the European Parliament have been the European Peoples Party (EPP) and the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D). The ID group's growth, while notable, has not been sufficient to surpass these established groups. Additionally, European Parliament elections are influenced by a wide range of factors, including national politics, economic conditions, and voter sentiment towards populist movements. As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there are no indications of a significant shift that would likely result in the ID group securing the most seats in the 2024 elections. Therefore, it is unlikely that the ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

Additionally, there have been no substantial reports or credible sources suggesting an impending announcement of this nature. Unless unforeseen circumstances arise, such as significant health issues or major political shifts, Biden is expected to continue his campaign for re-election.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Donald Trump’s performance against specific Democratic candidates can vary based on the candidate's individual popularity and the current political climate. Historical polling data indicates that Trump may perform differently when facing Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat. If Joe Biden is currently losing to Trump outside the margin of error, this suggests that Trump could have a relative advantage in a head-to-head matchup against Biden compared to a generic Democrat. However, the representativeness of Manifold respondents compared to the general public introduces uncertainty. Factors such as the demographic makeup of Manifold respondents, their political engagement, and potential biases could affect the outcome. Additionally, without specific data from the Manifold polls, it's challenging to precisely estimate the difference. Considering these variables, there is a moderate likelihood that Trump could gain at least a 3% advantage in this specific polling scenario.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of the information provided up to July 4th, 2024, there are indications of internal pressure within the Democratic Party for President Joe Biden to consider ending his re-election campaign. Specifically, two safe-seat Democratic House members have publicly urged Biden to drop out, and two other endangered Democrats have expressed doubts about his chances in the November election. Additionally, multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats suggest that there is some level of organized effort to persuade Biden to step aside.

However, the criteria for a "YES" resolution require that at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collectively ask Biden to end his campaign before July 20th. Currently, only four individuals are either actively urging Biden or have expressed skepticism about his reelection prospects, and there is no confirmation that they are acting as a unified group. Furthermore, until at least five qualified names are made public and it is clear that they are working together in a group message or similar collective action, the criteria for resolving "YES" are not met. Given these factors and the need for additional public commitment from more Democratic leaders, the likelihood of meeting the "YES" resolution criteria by the specified date remains uncertain.

Assessing the probability of both events occurring requires evaluating each condition individually and considering any potential interactions between them.

1. **Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat**: This depends largely on the dynamics of the specific poll questions, the current political climate, and voter sentiment towards both candidates. question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Reasoning: As of October 2023, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance remains the dominant political force in Hungary, led by Prime Minister Viktor Orbán. Historically, Fidesz-KDNP has secured a significant number of seats in both national and European Parliament elections, benefiting from a loyal voter base and effective political organization. Leading up to the 2024 European Parliament elections, several factors suggest that Fidesz-KDNP is likely to maintain its plurality:

1. **Political Dominance:** Fidesz-KDNP has established a strong political machinery and has been successful in mobilizing its base, often focusing on nationalist and conservative policies that resonate with a substantial portion of the Hungarian electorate.

2. **Leadership and Popularity:** Viktor Orbán's leadership has been a central pillar for the alliance. His ability to connect with voters and navigate both national and European issues likely contributes to sustained support.

3. **Opposition Fragmentation:** The opposition in Hungary has been fragmented, with multiple parties vying for the anti-Fidesz vote. This lack of a unified front can dilute efforts to challenge Fidesz-KDNP effectively.

4. **Electoral Strategy:** Fidesz-KDNP's strategic campaigning and resource allocation may give them an advantage in securing votes across various regions.

5. **Current Polling Data:** Recent polls leading up to the elections indicate that Fidesz-KDNP maintains a lead over other Hungarian parties, though the margin varies depending on the source.

However, potential challenges could impact this probability:

1. **Economic Conditions:** Economic issues, such as inflation or unemployment, might influence voter sentiment if perceived to be mishandled by the ruling alliance.

2. **EU Relations:** Strained relations with the European Union could either bolster nationalist support or galvanize opposition against Fidesz-KDNP, depending on voter perceptions.

3. **Emerging Opposition Alliances:** Any successful unification of opposition parties into a cohesive alliance could pose a significant challenge to Fidesz-KDNP's dominance.

Considering these factors, while Fidesz-KDNP holds a strong position, uncertainties related to economic conditions, EU relations, and opposition dynamics introduce variability to the outcome.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The European Union has been actively pursuing policies to enhance its domestic electric vehicle (EV) industry and reduce reliance on non-EU manufacturers, including those from China. While there have been ongoing discussions about ensuring fair trade practices and addressing concerns related to market access and intellectual property rights, the imposition of new tariffs or duties specifically targeting Chinese electric vehicle imports would require significant policy shifts. The EU typically considers the broader implications of such measures, including potential retaliatory actions from China, impacts on consumer prices, and the overall goal of promoting sustainable and competitive industries within the bloc. Additionally, both the EU and China have expressed interests in maintaining stable trade relations, which might act as a deterrent against implementing new tariffs in the near term. Given these factors, while there is a possibility of regulatory changes affecting EV imports, the likelihood of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, appears relatively low.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 and (b) the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources; and (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of both events occurring, we need to evaluate each condition separately and then consider their joint likelihood.

(a) **Fidesz-KDNP Maintaining EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024:**
Fidesz-KDNP, led by Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, has been a dominant political force in Hungary for over a decade. In the 2019 European Parliament elections, Fidesz-KDNP secured the highest number of Hungarian seats. However, political landscapes can shift due to various factors such as public sentiment, governance issues, and opposition strategies. As of October 2023, there haven't been significant indications of a major shift that would likely displace Fidesz-KDNP's plurality in the upcoming 2024 elections. Unless unforeseen political upheavals occur, it is reasonable to expect that Fidesz-KDNP will maintain its leading position.

(b) **EU Announcing New Tariffs on Chinese Electric Vehicles Before July 5, 2024:**
The European Union generally aims to maintain stable trade relations with major economies, including China. Introducing new tariffs typically occurs in response to specific trade imbalances, unfair trade practices, or retaliation for existing tariffs. As of the current knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there hasn't been a significant movement or public discourse within the EU pushing for new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles. Additionally, the EU is actively working on expanding its electric vehicle manufacturing capacity to reduce dependency on imports. Given these factors, the likelihood of the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles in the near future appears low.

**Joint Probability:**
While both events are individually plausible, the simultaneous occurrence depends on independent factors. Given the stable political standing of Fidesz-KDNP and the current EU trade policies favoring collaboration over new tariffs, the probability that both conditions are met by July 5, 2024, is relatively low.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

metadata.chain_of_thought: The projected opening weekend gross for "Deadpool x Wolverine" is between $340 million and $360 million globally, which would surpass the current record of $284.5 million set by the original "Deadpool." While the combination of Deadpool and Wolverine characters is highly anticipated and has a strong fan base, several factors could influence whether it truly sets a new record. These factors include market competition during the release weekend, marketing effectiveness, audience reception to the crossover, and general trends in R-rated movie performances. Additionally, historical data suggests that surpassing a record by such a margin is challenging, even with a popular franchise. Unless there is exceptionally strong demand and favorable conditions, it might be unlikely to exceed the existing record significantly.

However, without specific indications, this remains uncertain.

(b) **"Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie achieving the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie:** As of October 2023, there has been no official announcement or development regarding a "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. While both characters are popular within the Marvel universe, especially Deadpool who is known for breaking the fourth wall and his R-rated content, a direct crossover feature film would require significant coordination between studios and approval from copyright holders. Additionally, the current Deadpool film (Deadpool 3) is already in production, and introducing another crossover simultaneously could complicate scheduling and marketing efforts. Therefore, the likelihood of such a movie not only being released but also achieving the projected box office success is quite low.

Since both conditions need to be met for the overall question to resolve as YES, and given the uncertainties and current lack of indicators for both events, the probability is low.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Mike Pence has not indicated a strong intention to seek the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The primary field is dominated by prominent figures such as former President Donald Trump, who continues to hold significant influence within the Republican Party, as well as other emerging candidates like Ron DeSantis and Nikki Haley who are actively campaigning and gaining support. Pence's public presence and endorsements are comparatively limited, and he has not mounted a significant campaign effort to position himself as a leading contender. Additionally, his association with Donald Trump, especially following the events of January 6th, may polarize potential voters within the party. Given these factors, it is unlikely that Mike Pence will secure the Republican nomination by the time of the Republican National Convention in August 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, and (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.
(b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of October 2023, President Joe Biden is the incumbent Democrat running for re-election in 2024. Historically, incumbent presidents rarely drop out of their party's nomination race unless facing significant health issues or unforeseen circumstances. There have been no indications or public statements suggesting that President Biden intends to withdraw from the race before July 20, making the likelihood of him dropping out by that date extremely low.

On the Republican side, Mike Pence, the former Vice President, is a prominent figure within the party. However, the Republican nomination landscape is competitive, with other potential candidates like Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, former President Donald Trump, and others vying for the nomination. Mike Pence has expressed interest in running but has not secured the level of support necessary to be the frontrunner. Additionally, the Republican National Convention's selection process involves various factors, including primary election results and delegate counts, which currently do not strongly favor Pence over other candidates.

Given the unlikelihood of an incumbent president withdrawing early in the race and the competitive nature of the Republican nomination process, the probability that both conditions (a) and (b) occur is very low.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
As of October 2023, the Greens–European Free Alliance (Greens–EFA) are a growing political group within the European Parliament, known for their focus on environmental issues, sustainable development, and social justice. Historically, the largest political group in the European Parliament has been the European People's Party (EPP), a center-right coalition. The Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D) typically holds the second-largest number of seats, followed by groups like Renew Europe and Identity and Democracy (ID). 

While the Greens–EFA have been gaining traction and increasing their representation in recent elections, surpassing the EPP to become the largest group would require a significant and unprecedented shift in voter preferences across multiple EU member states. Such a shift would likely need to be driven by major political events or crises that realign the priorities and alliances of European voters. Additionally, the EPP has a well-established presence and organizational structure across numerous member states, which provides it with substantial advantages in elections.

Considering current trends, electoral forecasts, and the historical performance of political groups within the European Parliament, it appears unlikely that the Greens–EFA will secure the most seats in the 2024 elections. While they may continue to grow and potentially challenge the existing major groups, overtaking the EPP would represent a substantial change in the European political landscape.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, OpenAI's ChatGPT is accessible in most European Union countries, adhering to regional regulations like GDPR. While there have been instances of temporary restrictions in specific countries (e.g., Italy in early 2023), these issues are typically resolved to ensure broader accessibility. OpenAI has shown a consistent commitment to expanding its services and addressing regulatory requirements within the EU. Considering the ongoing efforts to maintain and enhance service availability, it is highly probable that by June 30, 2024, ChatGPT will be generally available across the European Union, allowing the majority of the population to access it without the need for VPNs.

question.body:
(a) The Greens–EFA political group must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. In case of a tie between groups, this resolves as **Yes**. (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT must be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. This resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on that date, meaning the default state for EU residents is access without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. Availability issues in some EU countries or to certain demographics (e.g., minors) do not affect this, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface and resolves positively if the name or website changes, as long as the service remains substantially the same.

For part (a), the Greens–EFA currently hold the fourth-most seats in the European Parliament based on the 2019 elections. While green parties have been gaining traction, especially with increasing focus on environmental issues, such a dramatic shift in voter preference within a single election cycle is unlikely without unforeseen political developments.

For part (b), ChatGPT is already generally available in the European Union as of 2023. Given ongoing support and continuous deployment by OpenAI, it is reasonable to expect that ChatGPT will remain available in the EU by June 30, 2024. There are no significant barriers anticipated that would prevent its availability, assuming continued compliance with EU regulations.

Since both events need to occur for the resolution to be YES, and part (a) is highly unlikely while part (b) is almost certain, the combined probability remains low.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that "Twisters" (2024) will achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, several factors need to be considered:

1. **Director’s Track Record**: Lee Isaac Chung is known for his critically acclaimed work, notably "Minari," which received widespread praise and won several awards, including an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. His involvement suggests a focus on strong storytelling and character development, which can positively influence critical reception.

2. **Cast**: Glen Powell and Daisy Edgar-Jones have gained recognition for their performances in recent projects. Their acting capabilities can contribute to a compelling film, potentially appealing to critics.

3. **Standalone Sequel**: As a standalone sequel, "Twisters" is not directly continuing the story of the 1996 "Twister." This approach allows for creative freedom and the possibility to refresh the narrative, which might be received well if executed effectively.

4. **Genre and Expectations**: The original "Twister" was an action-packed disaster film with a Tomatometer of 63%. Modern audiences and critics have different expectations, and advancements in filmmaking technology could lead to a more polished and engaging film, potentially garnering better reviews.

5. **Marketing and Hype**: The reception of trailers, marketing campaigns, and early buzz can influence critics' expectations. If "Twisters" generates positive anticipation, it might correlate with higher initial reviews.

6. **Competition**: The release window and competing films at the time can affect reviews. If "Twisters" stands out among its contemporaries, it might receive more favorable attention.

Considering these factors, Lee Isaac Chung's reputation and the talented cast are strong positive indicators. However, transitioning a beloved original into a standalone sequel carries inherent risks, and achieving a significantly higher Tomatometer than the original is ambitious.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, President Joe Biden is serving his first term and has not indicated any intention to resign. There have been no credible reports or indications of health issues that would lead to his inability to fulfill his duties. Additionally, there are no significant political movements or widespread support for impeachment that could result in his removal from office before the specified date. Historical trends show that incumbent presidents typically serve their terms unless unforeseen circumstances arise. Given these factors, it is highly likely that Biden will remain President through the end of July 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reviewing Joe Biden's recent and past media engagements, it is evident that while he participates in in-person interviews, they typically do not exceed 30 minutes of interview footage. His most substantial recent appearance was a ~70-minute interview on The Howard Stern Show in April. Other notable appearances, such as interviews with Stephanopoulos in July and Jimmy Fallon in February, as well as segments on '60 Minutes,' consistently featured less than 30 minutes of direct interview content. There have been no announcements or indications of plans for a significantly longer in-person interview exceeding 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. Given this pattern and the absence of forthcoming scheduled long-form interviews, it is unlikely that Joe Biden will engage in a 45+ minute in-person interview/conversation on camera within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The context indicates that dozens of House Democrats are actively organizing to oppose the Democratic National Committee's (DNC) plan to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination early. Representative Jared Huffman has circulated a drafted letter, suggesting that there is already significant momentum behind this opposition. Given that "dozens" typically refers to at least 24 individuals, it is highly likely that a sufficient number of Democrats will sign the letter to meet or exceed the 20-signature threshold. Additionally, internal party debates about nomination timing are common, and the presence of a coordinated effort increases the probability of achieving the required support within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The effort to secure at least 20 House or Senate Democrats to publicly oppose the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early faces significant challenges. The Democratic Party generally emphasizes unity, especially in presidential nominations, to maintain a strong front against opposition parties. While there are reports of some dissent within the party, achieving the threshold of 20 signatories is substantial and would require overcoming internal pressures to maintain party cohesion. Additionally, public opposition from a significant number of members could have strategic implications for the party's image and electoral prospects. Given these factors, it is unlikely that the required number of Democrats will sign the letter by the specified deadline.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Historically, the Democratic Party has rarely experienced brokered conventions, especially in recent decades where the primary system has been well-established. A brokered convention occurs when no single candidate secures a majority of delegates on the first ballot, necessitating multiple rounds of voting to determine the nominee. In the 2024 election cycle, assuming the incumbent president (Joe Biden) is seeking re-election and maintains strong support within the party, it is highly likely that he would secure the necessary delegate majority on the first ballot. Additionally, there are no significant indicators of widespread dissent or fragmentation within the Democratic Party that would suggest the need for a brokered convention. Therefore, the probability that the Democratic Party will require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election is very low.

(b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

For part (a), the likelihood that at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early appears low. The Democratic Party has largely rallied around President Biden for re-nomination, and significant public dissent of this nature from multiple legislators would be unexpected unless there are substantial internal conflicts or controversies emerging.

For part (b), the probability of Democrats having a brokered convention in 2024 is also low. Brokered conventions typically occur when there is no clear frontrunner or when multiple candidates have strong support, leading to a contested nomination process. Given the current political landscape, with President Biden as the incumbent and presumed frontrunner, it's unlikely that the Democratic Party will face such a division that necessitates a brokered convention.

Assuming that these two events are independent, the combined probability of both occurring is therefore quite low.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Historically, the Olympic Games have seen a number of countries winning their first-ever gold medals, especially as the number of participating nations grows and as new countries emerge or gain independence. The 2024 Paris Olympics are expected to feature a diverse range of sports, some of which may allow nations with less traditional strength in Olympic competition to excel. Factors that could contribute to at least five countries winning their debut gold include the introduction of new sports or disciplines, advancements in training and facilities in emerging nations, and the natural progression of athletic development worldwide. question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:

The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.chain_of_thought: Individual Neutral Athletes typically represent a small contingent at the Olympic Games, often due to specific circumstances such as suspension of their national Olympic committees. Historically, the number of gold medals won by neutral athletes has been minimal. For example, in previous Olympics, neutral competitors have secured only a few medals at most. The Paris 2024 Olympics feature a wide range of events, but expecting Individual Neutral Athletes to collectively win 15 or more gold medals would require an unprecedented level of participation and success from a group that is usually limited in size. Additionally, there are stringent eligibility and participation criteria that further limit the number of neutral athletes. Given these factors, it is highly unlikely that Individual Neutral Athletes will achieve 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals?
question.body:

1. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to credible sources.
2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this part resolves immediately to "Yes".

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Assessing the probability that both conditions will be met at the Paris 2024 Olympics involves evaluating each condition separately and then considering their joint likelihood.

1. **At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal**: Historically, it's relatively rare for multiple countries to secure their first-ever Olympic gold medals in a single Games. While emerging nations have shown improvement and increased competitiveness in various sports, the Olympics have a limited number of gold medals available, making it challenging for five new countries to achieve their first golds in one edition. Previous Olympics have seen only a handful of nations winning their first gold, so achieving five would require exceptional performances from emerging teams.

2. **Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals**: The designation "Individual Neutral Athletes" typically arises from geopolitical situations or sanctions that prevent athletes from competing under their national flags. The number of neutral athletes is usually limited, and historically, they account for a small fraction of the total medal tally. Securing 15 or more gold medals as neutral competitors would require an unusually high concentration of top-performing athletes competing without national affiliations, which is highly improbable given the current structure and distribution of talent across nations.

Considering both conditions simultaneously reduces the likelihood further. The combination of multiple nations achieving their first golds and a significant number of neutral athletes winning gold medals is unprecedented and lacks historical precedence.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Identity and Democracy (ID) group is a right-wing populist and Eurosceptic political group within the European Parliament. Historically, the largest groups in the European Parliament have been the European People's Party (EPP) and the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D). While there has been a noticeable rise in support for populist and nationalist parties in recent European elections, it remains unlikely that the ID group will surpass the EPP or S&D to become the largest group. Factors contributing to this include the entrenched support bases of the traditional center-right and center-left blocs, coalition dynamics among European political groups, and the diversity of political landscapes across member states. Additionally, the ID group's stance on key issues may limit its appeal to a broader electorate necessary to achieve the most seats. Considering these elements, the probability that the ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections is relatively low.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024; (b) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. It will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are not met. If two political groups are tied for seats, condition (b) will still resolve as Yes.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To determine the probability that both conditions (a) and (b) will occur, we need to assess each condition individually based on the current political landscape and trends up to the knowledge cutoff in October 2023.

Condition (a): The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024.

As of October 2023, the primary political parties and coalitions in France include Renaissance (formerly La République En Marche!), the National Rally (Rassemblement National), The Republicans, and the Socialist Party, among others. The New Popular Front and Together are not currently dominant forces in French politics. Given the existing political dynamics and the fragmentation of the left and right, it is plausible that the Prime Minister will emerge from a coalition different from NFP or Together. Unless there is a significant and unexpected realignment in French politics, it is likely that neither NFP nor Together will be the leading coalition by mid-2024.

Condition (b): The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections.

The ID political group likely refers to the Identity and Democracy group in the European Parliament, which comprises right-wing populist and nationalist parties. In the 2019 European Parliamentary Elections, the European People's Party (EPP) and Renew Europe were the leading groups, with ID holding a significant but not majority share of seats. Projecting forward to 2024, while there may be shifts in voter sentiment, it is uncertain whether ID will surpass traditional powerhouses like EPP or Renew Europe to hold the most seats. Historical trends and the fragmented nature of European politics suggest that it is unlikely for ID to be the dominant group, although increased support cannot be entirely ruled out.

Combined Assessment:

For both conditions to be met, not only must the French Prime Minister come from a coalition other than NFP or Together, but the ID group must also secure the highest number of seats in the European Parliament. Given the assessment of condition (a) as likely and condition (b) as unlikely, the probability that both conditions are satisfied simultaneously is relatively low.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

While the competition is always stiff, and outcomes can vary each year, Switzerland's consistent track record suggests a favorable probability of qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, Ted Cruz has established himself as a prominent figure within the Republican Party, having previously served as a U.S. Senator and as the 2016 Republican presidential nominee. However, the 2024 Republican primary field is highly competitive, featuring strong candidates such as former President Donald Trump, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, and others who have significant support and high visibility. Trump's enduring influence and loyal base present a substantial challenge for any contender. Additionally, Ron DeSantis has emerged as a leading candidate with substantial backing and momentum. While Ted Cruz remains a respected and experienced politician, the current dynamics of the Republican primary suggest that securing the nomination would require overcoming significant obstacles. Therefore, the probability of Ted Cruz becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election appears to be relatively low given the current competitive landscape.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, national polling averages indicated that Joe Biden held a lead over Donald Trump. Political dynamics leading up to the 2024 presidential election are influenced by various factors, including economic conditions, foreign policy developments, campaign strategies, and unforeseen events. Historical polling data shows that lead margins can fluctuate based on these variables. Given the current trends and assuming no significant shifts occur between now and July 15, 2024, it is moderately likely that Trump's lead over Biden could grow slightly. However, surpassing a 2-point lead and reaching up to 3 points would require favorable conditions for Trump, which, based on existing data, seem possible but not highly probable.

Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) has a history of scrutinizing executive compensation packages, especially those perceived as excessively large or not aligned with company performance. Elon Musk's proposed $57 billion compensation package for Tesla is unprecedented in scale and has already attracted significant attention and debate within the investment community and among shareholders. Given ISS's role in providing proxy advisory services and its tendency to advocate for shareholder interests, it is plausible that ISS would advise shareholders to vote against such a substantial pay package to ensure executive compensation remains reasonable and performance-based. Additionally, while Kimbal Musk's re-election to Tesla's board may not be as contentious as the compensation package, ISS might still consider broader governance factors before making a recommendation. However, the primary driver for a "Yes" resolution is more likely tied to the criticism of Elon Musk's compensation plan rather than Kimbal Musk's board membership.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Kalenjin ethnic group from Kenya is renowned for producing some of the world's most elite long-distance and marathon runners. Historically, Kalenjin athletes have dominated the men's marathon at the Olympics, consistently securing top positions. On the women's side, while Kenyan (including Kalenjin) athletes are highly competitive, there has been growing strength from other nations, particularly Ethiopia, which has also produced exceptional female marathoners. The outcome of both men's and women's marathons at the 2024 Paris Olympics will depend on various factors, including the current form of the athletes, training conditions, and competition from other top contenders. While it is plausible for Kalenjin athletes to win both events given their strong track record, the increasing depth and competitiveness, especially in the women's field, make it somewhat less certain.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Crimean Bridge, also known as the Kerch Strait Bridge, is a strategically significant infrastructure connecting mainland Russia to Crimea. Given the ongoing geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine, the bridge has been a potential target for attacks aiming to disrupt Russian logistics and assert military pressure. Historically, critical infrastructure in conflict zones has been susceptible to targeted attacks to achieve strategic objectives. However, mounting an attack on such a prominent structure would require substantial planning, resources, and risk assessment by any opposing force. Additionally, the presence of heightened security measures and surveillance around the bridge may deter potential attacks. Considering the balance between the strategic value of the bridge for Russia and the challenges involved in successfully executing an attack without significant collateral damage or international repercussions, it is plausible but not highly likely that the Crimean Bridge will be targeted before July 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: Invoking Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare President Biden incapacitated is an unprecedented and highly unlikely event. This process requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another designated body) to formally assert that the President is unable to perform the duties of the office. Historically, Section 4 has never been used, reflecting its severe implications for presidential authority and the stability of the executive branch. Additionally, there is no substantial evidence or credible reports suggesting that such a move is being seriously considered or supported within the administration or among key political stakeholders. The invocation of this amendment would necessitate a significant and unlikely consensus among the Vice President and Cabinet members, making the probability of this occurring before August 2024 exceedingly low.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

metadata.chain_of_thought: The International Criminal Court (ICC) operates based on strict legal procedures and requires substantial evidence before issuing arrest warrants. As of the knowledge cutoff in October 2023, the ICC has been conducting a preliminary examination into the situation in Palestine, which includes assessing potential war crimes in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Issuing arrest warrants for high-profile Israeli leaders such as Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi would necessitate clear and compelling evidence of their personal involvement in crimes under ICC jurisdiction. Additionally, such actions would have significant diplomatic and political ramifications, potentially impacting international relations and the ICC's standing. Given these factors, while the ICC has the authority to act, the likelihood of issuing arrest warrants for these specific individuals before July 1, 2024, appears low based on the current information and procedural requirements.

metadata.chain_of_thought:

As of October 2023, there have been no credible indications or significant events that would necessitate such an action against President Biden. Regarding the International Criminal Court (ICC) issuing arrest warrants for Israeli leaders like Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi, the ICC operates based on evidence and legal procedures. While there have been ongoing investigations into possible war crimes related to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, issuing arrest warrants for high-ranking officials, especially from a country with significant global influence like Israel, is unprecedented and would likely face significant political and legal challenges. The timeframe before July 1, 2024, is relatively short for such a process to culminate in arrest warrants being issued.

Given the improbability of both these events occurring within the specified timeframes, the likelihood of the question resolving as YES is extremely low.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, President Joe Biden has not indicated any intention to step down or refrain from seeking a second term in the 2024 election. While his age (he would be 82 at the start of the next term) is a factor that might influence his decision, there have been no definitive public statements or credible reports suggesting that he plans to decline the Democratic nomination. Additionally, incumbent presidents typically seek re-election unless there are significant political, personal, or health-related reasons to withdraw. Given the absence of concrete indications to the contrary, it is more likely that Biden will continue his campaign for re-election rather than announcing his decision not to seek the nomination before July 15, 2024.

question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, President Joe Biden has not indicated any intention to decline seeking re-election, and incumbents typically have a strong advantage in securing their party's nomination. Without any public announcements suggesting otherwise, it is unlikely that Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination. Regarding Chris Christie, while he is a recognized figure within the Republican Party, there are multiple other candidates vying for the nomination, and Christie has not demonstrated significant momentum to secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 Presidential Election. Given the competitive nature of the Republican primary and Christie's current standing, it is improbable that he will become the Republican nominee. Assuming that these two events are independent, the combined probability of both occurring is the product of their individual probabilities, both of which are low.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The combined domestic box office openings of "Deadpool" ($132.4 million) and "The Wolverine" ($53.1 million) total approximately $185.5 million. "Deadpool & Wolverine," as a crossover film, has the potential to attract fans from both franchises, possibly boosting its opening weekend performance. Additionally, the popularity of superhero movies continues to grow, and crossovers often generate significant buzz and anticipation. However, factors such as market competition at the time of release, marketing effectiveness, and audience reception of the crossover concept could influence the actual performance. Assuming strong marketing and positive fan reception, it is plausible that "Deadpool & Wolverine" could surpass the combined openings of its predecessors.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Nikki Haley is a prominent figure within the Republican Party, having served as the U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations and as the Governor of South Carolina. Her experience in both domestic governance and international diplomacy gives her a solid foundation as a presidential candidate. However, the Republican field for the 2024 nomination is highly competitive, with several candidates who have strong support bases, substantial fundraising capabilities, and significant endorsements from key party figures. Factors such as primary election performance, debate showings, and shifts in voter sentiment leading up to the Republican National Convention will play crucial roles in determining the nominee. While Nikki Haley has the credentials and backing to be a serious contender, the likelihood of her securing the nomination depends on how she navigates these competitive dynamics and distinguishes herself from other candidates.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: Invoking the 25th Amendment Section 4 to declare President Biden incapacitated would require the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to formally determine that the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of the office. As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there has been no substantial evidence or credible reports suggesting that President Biden is incapacitated in a manner that would necessitate such a declaration. Additionally, invoking the 25th Amendment is a significant and politically charged action, rarely used in U.S. history, with no precedent since its adoption in 1967. The current political climate does involve partisan tensions, but there is no widespread or organized movement within the Cabinet or among top officials to pursue this course of action against President Biden. Therefore, the likelihood of the 25th Amendment Section 4 being invoked before August 2024 remains extremely low.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

metadata.chain_of_thought: For both conditions to be met by August 2024, two significant and unlikely events would need to occur simultaneously. (a) Nikki Haley as the Republican nominee: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, Nikki Haley has not officially entered the 2024 Republican presidential race. The Republican field includes prominent figures such as former President Donald Trump and Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, who have strong support bases and significant campaign infrastructures. While Nikki Haley is a recognized figure within the party, the likelihood of her securing the nomination without having already launched a campaign is low. (b) Biden declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Invoking the 25th Amendment's Section 4 requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to formally declare the President incapable of performing his duties. Such a declaration is a grave and politically sensitive action that typically occurs only under extreme circumstances. As of October 2023, there have been no credible indications or discussions suggesting that such a move is imminent or being considered. Given the current political landscape and the absence of indications supporting either event, the probability of both occurring within the specified timeframe is exceedingly low.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of October 2023, there have been no indications or credible reports suggesting that President Joe Biden intends to resign from the presidency or drop out of the upcoming election. Historically, sitting U.S. presidents do not resign without significant reason, and there have been no signs of political or personal crises that would prompt such actions. Additionally, Biden has been actively involved in his administration's initiatives and has not signaled any plans to step down. Given the absence of any substantive evidence or announcements, it is highly unlikely that he will make both announcements before the end of July 2024.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: As of October 2023, Donald Trump is under investigation in Georgia for potential election-related offenses, among other legal matters. While witness tampering is a serious charge, there has been no public indication or evidence specifically pointing towards Trump engaging in such behavior related to the Georgia case. Legal proceedings, especially those involving high-profile individuals, can be complex and lengthy, often taking considerable time to reach indictments or charges. Additionally, prosecutorial decisions depend on the discovery of substantial evidence to support such serious allegations. Given the specificity of the charge and the lack of public evidence suggesting witness tampering, it appears unlikely that Trump will be charged with witness tampering in Georgia by June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Historically, Iceland has had a mixed record in qualifying for the Eurovision Grand Final, with qualification rates fluctuating around 50-60% in recent years. Factors influencing their chances include the strength of their entry, performance quality, and competition in the semi-final they participate in. Without specific information about the 2024 entry's strengths or the competitive landscape of that year's semi-finals, it's reasonable to estimate a moderate probability of qualification based on past performance trends.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: Ireland has a historic legacy in the Eurovision Song Contest, having won the competition seven times. However, in recent years, their performance has been less stellar, with fewer qualifications for the Grand Final. The selection process for Eurovision 2024 will involve Ireland participating in a semi-final, where competition is fierce. Factors such as the quality of the song, staging, and public reception will play crucial roles in their qualification. Given Ireland's recent track record and the competitive nature of the semi-finals, there is uncertainty about their ability to secure a spot in the Grand Final.

question.title: Will both Iceland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Iceland and Ireland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that both Iceland and Ireland will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors. Historically, both countries have had varied success in Eurovision. Ireland has the most wins in the competition's history but has struggled to consistently qualify in recent years. Iceland, while never having won, has had notable high placements but has also faced periods where it did not qualify for the final.

As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, specific details about the 2024 entries for both countries, including song quality, artist popularity, and staging, are not yet available. These factors play a significant role in qualification outcomes. Additionally, the Eurovision voting system, which includes both jury and public votes, introduces an element of unpredictability.

Given the lack of specific information about the 2024 performances and considering the historical performance trends of both countries, it's reasonable to estimate the probability of each country qualifying independently at around 50%. However, since the events are likely not entirely independent—factors like regional voting patterns and overall competition strength can influence both qualifications—the combined probability of both qualifying is somewhat lower.

Resolver
